message:
Keystone is litigating under the terms of NAFTA, which means it's not going to US courts. Instead, it will use the tribunals in that """"trade agreement"""" to demand payment for what it expected it would have earned if it had built and operated the pipeline. Thus, the damages it claims
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
attorney that can also practice as a litigator for the very corporations on which he/she sits in judgement. Outraged? Even more outrageous is this same provision in the mother of all trade agreements: TTP, now coming up for approval by the U. S. Congress, after it approved Fast Track Authority.
